item.title: Project Songbird launches March 26
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Psychological horror game dated.

Psychological horror game Project Songbird will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on March 26, FYRE Games announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via FYRE Games:

About

Project Songbird is a first-person cinematic narrative psychological horror game from Conner Rush and his studio FYRE Games, the developer behind the critically praised games Summerland and We Never Left (from Dread X Collection 5).

Take control of Dakota, a career musician who, amidst writer’s block, decides to isolate themself in a cabin in the remote Appalachian forest in order to record their next album. Take in this gripping tale, explore the natural environment and haunting dreamscapes, and fight to survive in this short horror experience.

Features

  • A dark, enthralling four-to-five hour narrative to keep you hooked and guessing until the end.
  • Gorgeous visuals as you traverse numerous and diverse environments, presented with a cinematic, film-like aesthetic.
  • Ranged and melee combat with upgradeable weapons to help you survive your nightmarish journey.
  • A stellar voice cast, starring Valerie Rose Lohman (What Remains of Edith Finch, Wolfenstein: Youngblood), Jonah Scott (Dying Light 2: Stay Human, BEASTARS), and Aleks Le (Persona 3 Reloaded, Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba).
  • A permadeath system that brings real weight and tension to every encounter.
  • A beautifully dynamic soundtrack composed and performed by Jacob Noska, Jonah Henthorne, and Erwin Dorsainville: members of the band Auric Echoes.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Turn-based rock tour RPG Sonic Terror announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Set in an alien-infested 1984.

Publisher Human Qube Games and developer Book Burner Games have announced Sonic Terror, a turn-based tactical RPG where music is magic and the only weapon against a space alien parasite. It will be available for PC via Steam, with unspecified consoles to follow. A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, Human Qube Games:

About

Sonic Terror is a turn-based tactical RPG where music is brutal magic and the only weapon against a space alien parasite that has turned silence into a new law.

Set in an alternative 1984, Sonic Terror puts you in control of an outlaw rock band on tour through a totalitarian Republic invaded by body-snatching aliens. The only thing they’re afraid of is music—and you’re the last ones to play it.

You Are Sonic Terror, a Young Rock Band That Refuses to Shut Up

Shape your bandmates’ personalities, keep them alive, sober, and inspired, and use their songs as brutal power which blasts the enemies into pieces.

Each show is a tactical, turn-based battle—no dice rolls, no rhythm gimmicks. Every riff, bassline, and drum strike is a spell, and every victory brings your music closer to salvation. The soundtrack evolves with your success and fades when you falter—the music literally fights back.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Grounded 1984 science-fiction setting where an alien mind-control threat can only be fought with music.
  • Character-driven story about freedom and the coming of age.
  • Three playable, clash-prone musicians with distinct personalities and abilities.
  • Shower, soup, and sleep. Even punks need love and care. Keep them fed, alive, and not too hungover.
  • Turn-based tactical combat where riffs, basslines and drum blasts are spells with the power to save the world.
  • An adaptive soundtrack that grows stronger as you succeed and fades when you get hit.
  • A handcrafted world and dynamic, twisted storyline that unfolds across a last-ditch rock tour.
  • Unexpected touch of alien technology for musical instruments and gear upgrades.

The Tour Begins

Get on your tour bus with a mysterious driver at the wheel. Sabotage the regime, uncover the truth behind the alien invasion, and decide whether your band will burn out in glory—or fade into silence.

The only thing they fear is music. You’re the only ones left to play it.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.
